channel.title: missing-data on James Uanhoro
channel.description: Recent content in missing-data on James Uanhoro

item.title: Little's MCAR test at different sample sizes
item.description: TLDR: Little’s MCAR test is unable to tell data that are MCAR from data that are MAR in small samples, but maintains the nominal error rate when null is true across a wide range of sample sizes. I just found out about the R simglm package and decided to do a small simulation to test Little’s MCAR test1 under different sample sizes. I could have investigated heteroskedasticity in linear regression instead, and I probably will in the future.
